page.title: 04Church of The Holy Ghost
page.content: Crowcombe church is built in red sandstone, {the tower}is the oldest part of the church and dates from the 14th century. The tower has{6 bells}one of which bears the date 1534. { In the east window}and three other windows in the south aisle, a few small remains of 15th century glass are visible. At the north end of the church is the Old Chapel - remade in 1665 by {Thomas Carew}for the family of Crowcombe Court. Apart from its delightful natural setting, the most interesting feature of the church is its{bench ends}- all hand carved. In the churchyard beyond the east window can be seen the original spire felled by a thunderstorm.
